data.title: John Wayne: An American Experience
data.meta_description: John Wayne: An American Experience is an award-winning museum located in the heart of the Fort Worth Stockyards. Visit us today!
data.text:
Visit us at Fort Worth Stockyards

John Wayne:

An American

Experience

John Wayne: An American Experience is located in the heart of the Fort Worth Stockyards! Featuring over 400 pieces of personal and professional memorabilia, the exhibit will take you through John Wayne's life and how he achieved the ultimate American dream through hard work and determination.

The Exhibit

Sprawling over 10,000 square feet, the exhibit is structured to give you an intimate tour of the life of John Wayne. Starting with his early childhood and career, each room highlights an aspect of The Duke’s legacy.

This special space can accommodate up to 348 guests.

The John Wayne: An American Experience is the perfect choice for those looking for the best of Fort Worth holiday parties, corporate events or exceptional party venues for private after hours access and exclusive shopping at John Wayne Stock and Supply.

Inspired by the pioneering spirit of the West, the Hotel Drover offers a unique blend of Western charm and modern amenities. The hotel features stylish and comfortable accommodations, including spacious guest rooms and suites, each with its own unique character and charm. The hotel offers a range of amenities, including a farm-to-table restaurant, a rooftop bar, and a fitness center, as well as access to nearby attractions.

The Cowboy and Cowgirl Channel is a television network that celebrates the Western lifestyle and culture through a variety of programming, including documentaries, films, and TV series that highlight the history and traditions of the American West. Viewers can tune in to watch live rodeo events, Western music performances, and cooking shows that showcase authentic Western cuisine.

Mule Alley is a historic shopping and dining district located in the Fort Worth Stockyards that has been beautifully restored to its original 19th-century charm. The alley features a variety of boutique shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues, making it a must-visit destination for anyone interested in experiencing the history and culture of the Old West.

The Lonesome Dove is a restaurant located in the Fort Worth Stockyards that serves upscale Texas-style cuisine inspired by ingredients and cultures of the West. The restaurant features a rustic, western-themed atmosphere and offers a menu of delicious dishes made with locally-sourced ingredients, making it one of Fort Worth’s premiere dining establishments.

Downtown Cowtown at the Isis Theatre is a live theater venue located in the heart of downtown Fort Worth that specializes in Western-themed plays and musicals. The historic theater has been beautifully restored to its original 1930s Art Deco style, offering a unique and immersive theatrical experience for audiences of all ages.

The Cowboy Channel Bar is a western-themed bar and restaurant located in the heart of the Fort Worth Stockyards. The bar features live music, a selection of craft beers and cocktails, and a menu of delicious Texas-style cuisine, making it a popular destination for anyone looking to experience the true spirit of the American West.

John Wayne Gold Handle Coffee Co pays homage to the legendary Hollywood actor and his love of coffee. The shop offers a variety of specialty coffee drinks and features decor inspired by Wayne’s Western films, making it a unique and fun stop for fans of the Old West. The brand’s iconic gold handle coffee mug, inspired by John Wayne’s signature style, is a popular souvenir among visitors.

Home of the world’s first indoor rodeo, Cowtown Coliseum is a historic venue that has been hosting rodeos and other western-themed events since 1908. The coliseum features a large arena floor and seating for over 3,400 spectators, as well as a concession stand and souvenir shop. Visitors can witness heart-pumping rodeo events such as bull riding and barrel racing, or attend concerts by top country music artists.

The Fort Worth Herd Cattle Drive is a twice-daily reenactment of the Old West cattle drives that used to take place in Fort Worth. Visitors can watch as a herd of Texas Longhorns, guided by cowboys on horseback, parade through the streets of the Fort Worth Stockyards. The cattle drive is a unique and exciting way to experience the rich Western heritage of Fort Worth.

The Texas Cowboy Hall of Fame honors the cowboys and cowgirls who have made a significant impact on the Western way of life. The museum features exhibits showcasing the history and culture of the American West, including artifacts and memorabilia related to ranching, rodeo, and Western art. Inductees into the Hall of Fame are selected based on their contributions to the Western lifestyle, such as legendary cowboys Roy Rogers and Gene Autry.
